title: How to Make Coconut Tarts

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
Place the flour in a mixing bowl and add the butter.
Cut the butter into the flour by hand or with an electric mixer.
Whisk the egg yolk and water lightly and add, continuing to mix.
Knead the dough and roll it out when the mixing is complete.
Place the dough onto a metal baking sheet lined with baking paper and refrigerate.
Take the tray out after an hour or so and use a round cutter to cut the pastry into circles.
steps.description: Twisting the cutter will help to cut the dough easily. Knead the dough again if there is any left over, roll it out and cut more circles. Repeat until all the dough has been used.

steps.headline: Place the pastry circles into lightly greased patty (or tart) tins.
Pierce the bottom of the pastry with a fork
steps.description: This prevents the pastry from bubbling up on the bottom.

steps.headline: Place a spoonful of jam in the center of each pastry.
steps.description: Don't use too much jam or the tarts will be too sweet.

steps.headline: Beat the desiccated coconut, caster sugar and the lightly beaten egg in a mixing bowl.
Spoon the coconut filling on top of the jam.
Place the tarts in the oven and bake for 30 minutes, more or less,  checking often to see if the top is golden brown.
Take the tarts out of the oven once they are golden brown and touch them to make sure they are hard.
steps.description: If they are still soft, put them back in the oven; if not, they are done.

steps.headline: Remove the tarts from the tins usimg a fork and place each tart on a plate.
steps.description: The tarts can get really sticky so be careful when taking washing the tray.

steps.headline: Decorate with a touch of lime or lemon zest if desired.
steps.description: Let it sit to dry for about 10 mins or so to ensure it's crunchy on the outside.

steps.headline: Serve your delicious coconut tarts and smile at your guest's delight!

text: Making the Base Dough Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).  Place the flour in a mixing bowl and add the butter.  Cut the butter into the flour by hand or with an electric mixer.  Whisk the egg yolk and water lightly and add, continuing to mix.  Knead the dough and roll it out when the mixing is complete.  Place the dough onto a metal baking sheet lined with baking paper and refrigerate.  Take the tray out after an hour or so and use a round cutter to cut the pastry into circles. Twisting the cutter will help to cut the dough easily. Knead the dough again if there is any left over, roll it out and cut more circles. Repeat until all the dough has been used. Place the pastry circles into lightly greased patty (or tart) tins.  Pierce the bottom of the pastry with a fork This prevents the pastry from bubbling up on the bottom. Making the Coconut Filling Place a spoonful of jam in the center of each pastry. Don't use too much jam or the tarts will be too sweet. Beat the desiccated coconut, caster sugar and the lightly beaten egg in a mixing bowl.  Spoon the coconut filling on top of the jam.  Baking Place the tarts in the oven and bake for 30 minutes, more or less,  checking often to see if the top is golden brown.  Take the tarts out of the oven once they are golden brown and touch them to make sure they are hard. If they are still soft, put them back in the oven; if not, they are done. Remove the tarts from the tins usimg a fork and place each tart on a plate. The tarts can get really sticky so be careful when taking washing the tray. Decorate with a touch of lime or lemon zest if desired. Let it sit to dry for about 10 mins or so to ensure it's crunchy on the outside. Serve your delicious coconut tarts and smile at your guest's delight!
